text: In a mixing bowl, beat 1 egg, 1 cup of plain yogurt, and 2 tablespoons canola oil.  Add 1 cup of whole wheat flour, 1 teaspoon baking powder, 1 tablespoon sugar, 1/2 teaspoon baking soda, and 1/4 teaspoon salt.  Mix well. If batter is too thick, thin with water. Pour Batter onto a hot, lightly greased electric griddle, making each pancake 4 inches (10.2 cm) in diameter.  Cook until bubbles form on edges or if golden brown. (These pancakes don't taste good burnt!!!) Now for the apples, core 1 soft medium sized apple per person.  Now cut into quarters  Melt a pat of butter in a saucepan and put on medium-low heat.  Drop in apples and turn up the heat just a tiny notch.  Sprinkle 1 tsp. of ground cinnamon and 2 tsp. of brown sugar over the apples. If you are daring add  1 tsp. of white sugar too. Now cover with a lid for 3 minutes, occasionally flipping and moving around the apples. Cook until they are nice and mushy! Serve apples on top of pancakes. ENJOY!!!! !
